assessment.title: Anatomy and Direction of the Digestive System

body.p: After nutrients are absorbed in the abdomen from the digestive system, they are distributed throughout the body in order to get to the limbs and extremities. What direction are the nutrients travelling?

feedback.p: Incorrect. Material does go all through the body, including this direction, but the limbs are distal to the body.
Incorrect. Material does go all through the body including this direction, but the limbs are distal to the body.
Correct. Distal means away from the center of the body. Arms and legs are distal from the abdomen.
Not quite. Lateral means moving to the side, away from the center-line sagittal plane of the body but distal describes moving to the extremities from the center of the body.
